website_summaries.verdict: Though a modern version of a classic children's board game, it continues to offer the engaging play and affordable fun that kids have enjoyed for years.
pros: An exciting game that takes children down paths filled with candy on a race to the finish
Plays similarly to the classic version enjoyed by kids for several decades
cons: Some parents gripe that they don't like the new graphics, but more rave about the fun they have playing the game with their kids

customer_reviews.title: The "new improved" artwork is not for little kids!
customer_reviews.text: I bought Candyland as my youngest granddaughter is now of the age to play. However, when I looked at the board, I was extremely disappointed!! The snowflake princess looks like a beauty pagant contestant, and then there is the licorice creepy, leering Spaniard (really?) holding a snake!? This board is sending very negative messages to our little ones! Please beware!!!
customer_reviews.author: mjc

customer_reviews.title: No longer suitable for younger children
customer_reviews.text: The new layout of this game is terrible for young children. The spaces are too small for the game pieces (which is challenging for little hands with developing fine motor skills) and the graphics are way too busy (which makes it hard for a child to easily follow the path). The recommended age range is 3-6, which I think was accurate for the original design, but it is certainly not true now. I was very disappointed when I saw the game board and we no longer try to play it because it is too frustrating for my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: M. Esh

customer_reviews.title: Not your mother's Candy Land
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my granddaughter thinking it was the classic version of the game. It's not. The female characters have had lip fillers and boob jobs. I remember playing this with my children as an early introduction to games that instilled fair play and how to win and lose graciously. This version has no "winner." It's all about the "adventure" which is fine, but then what is the point of a board game?
customer_reviews.author: SuzieG

customer_reviews.title: Similar to the game you remember
customer_reviews.text: When looking to buy Candyland for my son I was sad to hear that the newer versions of the game have a spinner rather than cards and that the characters have changed and are overly sexualized. I ended up with this versions and am happy with it. It has cards and while some of the characters are different from what I remember, they are not dressed in lingerie with lollipops over their breasts. My 4 year old lives this game and it's a great introduction into board games. Taking turns, matching colors, following rules, and sometimes losing are all great skills he is acquiring by playing this game.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Evans

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for kids and fun for the whole family
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 5 year old daughter and we had a blast. I enjoyed the optional game play they offer that each turn you pick 2 cards and choose which one you want to use. It not only helped the game go faster if we were in a bit of a rush, but it helped my daughter with developing logic and strategy skills. We played the regular way as well and it is always exciting when someone gets a character card and gets sent across the map. I highly recommend this game. The size was perfect and the colors bright and attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for younger children
customer_reviews.text: My 3YO wanted to play the board games we have for adults. We tried to make them work, but they are hard to understand. This is perfect because it's simple and completely understandable for a younger child. The game is bright and fun. It also takes me back to my childhood so there's some nostalgia. As an adult, it's a game I don't mind playing multiple times in a row
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Version sent was not the version shown
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the World of Sweets version, but the game that came was not the version pictured- it was the cheaper, flimsier version. I specifically didn't want the cheaper version due to the reviews that indicated it was poor quality. I had to send the game back- fortunately Amazon makes it very easy to do so. I'll probably try to buy this in the store, where I can make sure I am getting the right version.
customer_reviews.author: RHuston

customer_reviews.title: Horrible images
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and quickly returned it because the illustrations are repulsive. I grew up on the 1984 version. Just take a look at the Queen Frostine and compare them between the two versions. No wonder women have a hard time these days and constantly feel like they aren't enough; these unattainable bodies lead to more plastic surgery etc. Milton Bradley should be ashamed, you are following in Disney's footsteps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slight changes from what I remember as a kid
customer_reviews.text: So, this was purchased as a gift for my 4 year old for Christmas. She enjoyed playing it and was very happy with the purchase. It came in pristine condition as was to be expected from a “new” purchase. I only took a star off because Hasbro seems to have altered the game board from what it was 20 something years ago when my sisters and I played with it. Same idea, same game play, just lacks nostalgia (which has no impact on the kids, just us parents). Also, I don’t remember having so many double pieces as it has now, so the game goes by pretty fast.
customer_reviews.author: Ole Miss Rebel 8811

customer_reviews.title: They love to the the thrill of being at the very ...
customer_reviews.text: Remember playing candy land when I was little so I bought this board game for my children this Christmas and they played 2+ hours Christmas then again this morning for several hours! They love the thrill of being at the very end and getting a cinnamon roll card lol
customer_reviews.author: Melody Santiz

customer_reviews.title: Old people must be writing the bad reviews
customer_reviews.text: This game is so cute! My 5&7 year olds love this game and I love playing it with them. Not sure why there are negetive reviews. Have you seen the original Candyland game compared to this one? lol this is a major upgrade. This is the dusted off version of the old Candyland I grew up with. This game board is so colorful and bright and there is nothing inappropriate on this game or suggestive. The people complaining about this game are also the people complaining about millennials and touch screens. We will be keeping this one!
customer_reviews.author: Fluent_was

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the game pieces are too big for the board. One piece fills more that one square! And there is no way to put more than one piece on a square. The board is also incredibly overstimulating for kids because it is SO COLORFUL and every inch of the board is jam packed with as much stuff as they can fit on it. My young kids (correct age for the game) can't focus on the path. This was my favorite game growing up, and I'm going to have to buy the retro version that being sold or search thrift stores for an earlier version.
customer_reviews.author: Clara

customer_reviews.title: Great game for little ones
customer_reviews.text: Candy Land is the perfect game for little ones who can't really use logic or strategy yet, but still want to be able to play a board game. They only need to know their colors and they're set to go. My grandchildren love playing Candy Land when they come visit. I just bought one to give as a Christmas gift for two younger grandchildren, so they can play it at home, too. It's definitely a hit in our family.
customer_reviews.author: KDD

customer_reviews.title: Back to the Basics!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a special education teacher. Sadly, I discovered this year that many of my special needs kindergartners did not know their colors, even toward the end of the school year. I purchased this game, which NONE of them had ever played. They were enthused and begged to play it. I started to see progress before summer began. If you’re reading this and have kids, put down the iPads. Interact with your children the old-fashioned way - board games that encourage sportsmanship and bonding time with your children.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, and board not suitable for little ones
customer_reviews.text: The board is not much thicker than a cereal box cardboard (and it came with a bad wrinkle in it), further the overall look is just MUCH too "busy". Coupled with the small pathway, it is actually difficult to pick out the path and certainly spaces are too small for little hands to place and move markers around. We are returning this.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Conrad

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: This game is so fun, no matter what age you are! This comes with instructions just in case you need to remind yourself of the rules or how to play, but it is very straight forward! I personally like to use one of the tops of the boxes and spread out the cards. Once you pick a card, we put it back in the box. This way, everyone could get the best (or the worst) of the cards and it makes it way more fun than just one person getting the "special" candy/dessert cards. LOVE this game and would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: The perfect classic game
customer_reviews.text: Candy Land is the perfect classic game for the whole family. This game is basic enough for small children and as an adult it is still fun and exciting. It has brought back so many fun memories for me. I am so happy that I can share this fun game with my children. No skill is required and because it's all about matching colors it's a very simple game. There is a reason it has been around for so long. Also, the pieces are large enough they aren't a choking hazard. My 5yr old and I played and my 8mnth old just chewed on the pieces we were not using. It was a win win for all 3 of us!
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee Herche

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: The board, box and cards are incredibly flimsy. Only been able to play it twice and the box is already ripped and the board worn down at the fold. It seems like Hasbro is playing on nostalgia to fuel sales while providing a sub par product. I'm glad my daughter is having fun with a game I used to love at her age, but we'll see just how long that fun will last.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Arrived without game cards
customer_reviews.text: Bought this game for my granddaughter, but it arrived without game cards. Before I could tell her mother that I could easily get more cards, she threw it out, saying it did not look like the favorite older version she had loved as a child.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: The perfect first game for my Granddaughter and every kid you know !!!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t forget this game for every little kid!,,,, we all have happy memories of Candyland and all it’s yummy sweet candy graphics! Didn’t you dream about wandering round this kool place!?! Don’t you still when some senior citizen says, “ hey, remember Candyland!!! Digital games are kool. But there’s a special time and place for little kids — CANDYLAND!!! And everyone is getting a bag of candy treats from our childhood when we play!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware - The Playing Board is not the same as the one shown in this photo
customer_reviews.text: Our 7 year old son and 4 year old daughter were COUNTING the days for this game to arrive. It was specifically chosen for the Dulce de Leche Falls and Cookie area. The board that arrived had neither of those. It was a different board. Nothing worse than a misrepresented product and disappointed children!
customer_reviews.author: Angie C.

customer_reviews.title: More cheaply made than when I was a kid! Then again, sadly, so are a LOT of things.
customer_reviews.text: Cute game for kids, but so cheap now. The board is so thin and the spaces are so cramped together and difficult to distinguish from the next. The playing pieces consist of a wide plastic base in which you insert thin cardboard figures. The plastic base is so too wide for the spaces on the board and blocks the playing area too much. It probably frustrated me more than my Grandson, bc he doesn't know how much better the original was.
customer_reviews.author: World traveler wanna be

customer_reviews.title: Classic Game, Great Gift!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 3-year-old nephew as a Christmas present. He's been able to learn how to play with it assistance from his parents and really enjoys it. It appears the box art and graphics have been updated; I prefer the classic look. It's very hard to beat for the price. At a little under $10 it makes the perfect gift on its or can be combined with something else to help reach your budget.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M.

customer_reviews.title: 5 Sweet Stars :)
customer_reviews.text: My only critique is that the art was the original. This is a great game for kids to learn and play with. It teaches turn taking, colors, and counting. Also it's a great game to build good sportsmanship. You can be in the lead one minute and the next pool a pink treat card and zip back down the path! So it's a great game to just model to kids positive attitudes and outlooks. Less screen time and more family time!
customer_reviews.author: HappilyEverAfter

customer_reviews.title: Nice refresh design of classic game
customer_reviews.text: I remember having this game as a kid and understanding how it was a good game to learn how to play games; just didn't understand the candy appeal part since they looked terrible. Honestly, they've done a good job of updating the game and graphics so that it reflects more of the sweets we actually eat, and current princess and fairy designs that my 7yo daughter likes. She loves the game. Nice job!
customer_reviews.author: Crisis Doc

customer_reviews.title: Good For Non-Readers and Multiple Language Groups.
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great first game for smaller children! It allows young ones to practice game skills like good sportsmanship and taking turns, while encouraging counting. Also, since almost nothing in the game requires reading (assuming at least one person knows or can read the rules), this is inclusive of younger not-yet-readers as well as for groups in which there is more than one primary written/reading language. Success in the game depends on chance not strategy. This means losing is never linked to personal choice or ability. As a result, the focus can be on the fun rather than on competition.
customer_reviews.author: I ♡ Milwaukee

customer_reviews.title: everything about the classic game Candyland
customer_reviews.text: This is just like the original classic Candyland you might have played when you were a kid. For me it conjures memory of my family sitting around the dinner table playing a game before my brother was born and everybody got so busy and then before you know it we all grew up and I don't know whatever happened to that actual gameboard but I know that my family will never enjoy the unity that we once experienced ephemerally and sometimes while playing this exact game.
customer_reviews.author: JimTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great for Quarantine
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our very bored toddler during Quarantine 2020. She is 3 and picked up the game very quickly. She understood the premise of the game after the first time playing. Its nice for toddlers who are just starting to count. It has also been good for teaching her sportsmanship. Even if she doesnt win, she shakes everyones hand and tells them "good game".
customer_reviews.author: Erica Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: 4 year old is obsessed
customer_reviews.text: This is the larger size game which makes for more fun! My 4 year old (recently turned 4) wants to play about 6 times a day or me. He can easily follow directions and his excitement or disappointment when he gets the special cards is hilarious. Great game to teach how to be a good winner and loser. One of his favorite Christmas presents this year.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Francis

customer_reviews.title: My 4,8 year olds love it!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 & 8 year olds learned it fast, and enjoy it immensely! We play it often - the winner gets Yogurt !
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Carrell

customer_reviews.title: Love this game
customer_reviews.text: This is a game that was recommended from my kids teacher and my son is four years old he loves this game understand it and it’s been great playing there with him he enjoys it a lot it’s almost like monopoly but in quicker and he’s really fun watching my kids know in the colors and how many times he has to come for them is really exciting
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Defeat never tasted so sweet!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is really enjoying destroying the spirits of all of her quarantined housemates by becoming the ruling Goddess Of Candyland Victory! No one is safe from her winning streak and nothing seems to compare to her ego filled chortle! Thanks Hasbro, my daughter is well on her way to becoming a sugar villain of great renown. 😂
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. W

customer_reviews.title: No WAY
customer_reviews.text: I’m going to donate this game to goodwill. It’s a much cheaper version and waaay less detailed than the original edition. If you seek to play 3-5 minute games, get this edition.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie Walker

customer_reviews.title: Successful first game for toddler!
customer_reviews.text: As part of her Pre-K experience I started introducing my toddler to more activities to get her away from the screen. Board games being something I was looking forward to enjoying with her. This was a favorite of mine as a child and she enjoyed it tremendously. Easy to learn and great introduction to the world of board games.
customer_reviews.author: TrinityWolf

customer_reviews.title: Great for preschoolers and doesn’t take too long to play
customer_reviews.text: Great game for preschoolers. Super easy and fun. Only wish it had a holder for the cards but a plastic zip top bag easily does the trick. Also love that it takes only about 15 minutes to play vs Chutes and Ladders where you are sometimes in for a much much longer game depending how many times you go down the chutes.
customer_reviews.author: BoyzMomBoston

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Description
customer_reviews.text: Candyland the game is awesome! Just be aware that this is the Retro version of the game, the original version. Which isn't necessarily a bad thing if that is what you were looking for. Unfortunately that is not the version we were looking for. The front photo of the cover of the box, is the newer version. Which is what you think you are getting, but the inside photos are the older version. Very misleading and led to a quick return from me. Be clear in your description. Don't advertise one thing then bury pictures of the actual version. My kid is disappointed and I had to return it. Now off to find a matching version.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Remade and Updated - In a Bad Way.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my young children, reflecting nostalgically on my own childhood during which I would sit in front of this game board and play with the pieces for what seemed like hours. I was hoping for the same experience for them. Unfortunately they've remade the game where it now reflects that chaotic scenes in children's television programming. The game board is smaller, super crowded, and way too busy. It was difficult to even follow the colored road! I felt overstimulated just glancing at the board. It was really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made like the good old days
customer_reviews.text: received this today and so happy with the quality. I bought this for our 6 yr old granddaughter and she will love it. I particularly loved the game board. It is like the original one in that it is a good solid board which folds in half for storage. I bought, in the store, at Christmas the chutes and ladders game for her and it is very cheaply made with a flimsy board and just not the same quality as this. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: VA Review

customer_reviews.title: Classic Game
customer_reviews.text: Candy Land is the perfect game to play with young children. My grandson loves it at 5 years old and it has been a favorite for a couple of years. The cards are just heavy paper and might have been better if more substantial. But all in all, classic game.
customer_reviews.author: Jan M

customer_reviews.title: Still a fun, simple, game.
customer_reviews.text: Just as I remember as a kid. My kids enjoyed it and it’s very easy for smaller children to learn.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: NOT like the original game
customer_reviews.text: Game came intact. Very busy and colorful. It was my fault that I did not read that this was a different version from the original game. I gifted this to my 3-yr old nephew, hoping to follow our family's Candy Land tradition. It was not well received. This new game is too busy, hard to follow. The original game was simpler, easier for small ones to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy P.

customer_reviews.title: 3-5 year old fun
customer_reviews.text: Took this on vacation for the boys, First time playing a board game. It took a little while for the 5 year old that it's not fair to dig down in the deck to find the needed car ): but over time he's really starting to get the life lesson that it's not fair to cheat (what if his friend did that to him?} and that it's not always about winning, but having fun
customer_reviews.author: EJK

customer_reviews.title: It's a Classic!
customer_reviews.text: There's a reason this game has been around for decades. Easy to learn and easy to play. My 4-year-old and I have played this game a thousand times. It's a family game night win when you're playing with little ones who can't yet read! This version is also quite sturdy and will hold up to some toddler/preschooler abuse.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ortega

customer_reviews.title: As expected but prefer the older graphics
customer_reviews.text: I bought this game to play with my nieces and nephew (ages 3-6). The 3 year olds will need a little more time to get how to play since they are so used to screen games, but it is really easy to play and a great starter game and nice way to be interactive
customer_reviews.author: kiki

customer_reviews.title: beware
customer_reviews.text: This Hasbro version of the original Candy Land is very different. The board is covered with so many pictures that it is very difficult to even follow the path. The colors are very bright. This indefinitely sensory overload. Do not recommend this version, wish I had my old board : (
customer_reviews.author: D. Summers

customer_reviews.title: Just As I Remember It 50 Years Ago
customer_reviews.text: This is the same game I remember as a child. I also bought it for my children when they were little and this year bought it for my granddaughter. It is exactly as I remember it as a child. I am glad I got it because I didn't realize how much work I have to do with teaching my granddaughter on being happy when someone else wins. LOL
customer_reviews.author: PATOLA

customer_reviews.title: Who Doesn't Love Candy Land?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one because the youngest member of the family had nothing to do when at the house. The older kids were using up all the bandwidth and comfortable seating. The two of us broke out Candy Land and started playing. Next thing you know the older kids start reminiscing and want to play. Peace reigns throughout the Candy Land and I get my chair back!
customer_reviews.author: mfjturn56

customer_reviews.title: Classic game that all kids still love!
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter loves playing board games, and loves this one, in particular. After playing a few months, some of the cards are bent, and have started to fray from shuffling, but that's to be expected after 100 plays! This game stands the test of time!
customer_reviews.author: Katniss05Top Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Addictive, colorful and super fun
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to play with my toddler when quarantine began and we love it! It is super colorful & bright and all the candy pictures just spark their interest to play more. We love playing it as a family and now we are addicted. Would be a great gift and a good activity to keep children engaged when their friends visit.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul

customer_reviews.title: Possibly the best beginning board game for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I simply cannot think of a better beginning board game for your toddler. They will love the bright colors as well as the speed and simplicity of play. This familiar game sets up simply and teaches basic concepts of rules, turn taking, and paying attention. The game plays out in perhaps 5 minutes and therefore is quicker and easier to play than 'Chutes and Ladders'. Also, the child does not have to count as required in 'Chutes and Ladders'. Both games are excellent, but start with 'Candy Land' if you have any doubt of the toddlers ability to count and stay attentive for perhaps 15 minutes as necessary for 'Chutes and Ladders'.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Not the classic game board
customer_reviews.text: Really dislike the new board design and the new snowflake princess is NOT the type of female image I want my daughter having. Returning it and going to Wal-Mart for a more classic version.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: I prefer the original Candy Land game!!!
customer_reviews.text: Item is more more portrait looking than landscape, which Im actually not loving. Also, I was expecting it to be the original Candy Land game and it is not; the characters and the images on the board game are very different. Other than this, it’s a fun and interactive family game.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Take time to play!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 3 or more of these games in my life. My granddaughter won her first game with this. It’s worth your time. Time you never get back to play one on one (2 or 3) with this timeless classic.
customer_reviews.author: Nyl55

customer_reviews.title: A must
customer_reviews.text: This is a family favorite. My 4 year old loves to play this with his 8 year old brother and my 2 year old loves to walk on the board and take the gingerbread guys. This game is a staple in your home.
customer_reviews.author: Leah Long

customer_reviews.title: Still The Bomb!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help give some variety to my childs routine at home and not simply lean on screens for entertainment. Our child very enthusiastic to play this and other games now and has helped branch off into more educational options as well. This and chutes and ladders should be issued to every parent!
customer_reviews.author: Rob Goblin

customer_reviews.title: We love Candy land!
customer_reviews.text: We love candy land, or “the castle game” my kids call it! Our boys have been playing since they were 3! Great for kids to learn colors, directions, taking turns and sharing! Still fun for me, their mom at 31!
customer_reviews.author: Little Italy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn
customer_reviews.text: Who really needs to read a review for this iconic children’s game? It’s easy to learn...my 3 year old picked it up instantly! We love playing together. He’ll even put down his tablet to play!
customer_reviews.author: Mandy T

customer_reviews.title: ..not for a 3yo..
customer_reviews.text: ..the box says 3&up, but (maybe it's our day-and-age), my 3yo was disinterested mostly (he kept trying to jump past "the rules").. ..methinks 4-5&up is a better starting point for board games (not just Candy Land, but all in general)..
customer_reviews.author: c.

customer_reviews.title: Great game foe little ones
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this game for my kids when they were small and most recently for a grandchild. The family has a lot of fun playing it. Its easy for small children to understand and the candy theme is always a hit
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Classic game
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this game because it was a classic. But I think my child is actually a little to old for this game so I decided it wasn't for us. You may enjoy this for a younger child though.
customer_reviews.author: CRS

customer_reviews.title: So easy, yet the play it over and over again.
customer_reviews.text: Believe it or not, I’m a child of the 80s and randomly never had this! I’d never even played it until we bought it. It’s cute and easy. Draw a card. Move piece. Done. I feel like the original version (like all board games) would’ve been or better quality and art work, but our 4 and 6 year old love this game.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler J

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but graphically overwhelming for kids
customer_reviews.text: This is so different from the candyland in used to playing the board SO graphically busy, it's hard to see where you're supposed to move or what's happening. It was hard for our three year old neice to catch on bc there was a lot of images and not enough co tract between foreground and background.
customer_reviews.author: T_D_W

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun and happy toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Great classic game with hours of fun with kids. I did not play this game as a kid but was able to learn and play within 5 minutes of my 6 year old explaining. We played for hours and still is one of the favorite games to play.
customer_reviews.author: Rajen Pandya

customer_reviews.title: Classic game
customer_reviews.text: Great classic game, my toddler loves it. I have 4 stars just because I think that classic games from the 80s and 90s were better. The cartoons were better and the game board just looked better.
customer_reviews.author: JMC5

customer_reviews.title: There's a reason this game is still around.
customer_reviews.text: My 3 yr old grandson is totally obsessed with this game. He learned about taking turns (and cheating, lol), and focusing on where to place his gingerbread man token. The board is brightly colored and keeps his attention and increases his imagination. Good board game for the whole fmly.
customer_reviews.author: susan byers

customer_reviews.title: Very fun ! Great family time !
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE this game ! My son is a very smart 3 year old and he plays this game very well. We play at least twice a day !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Guest

customer_reviews.title: Great game for all!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my nephew and my grand children have this game also. My grandchildren are 9 & 4 and both enjoy playing it, especially the 4 year old. Inexpensive game and great for ages preschoolers on up. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: blake moon

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Yes this is an awesome purchase! Its great for our family game nights with our little girls. I highly recommend this game especially to help kids learn their colors.
customer_reviews.author: Kuheler

customer_reviews.title: The Best Version of Candy Land
customer_reviews.text: I like this version with cards the best! I don't prefer the Candy Land with the spinner, so I'm glad they still make this original version. It's quick, fun, and the little ones love it!
customer_reviews.author: L. Shirk

customer_reviews.title: Overly simple and somewhat boring
customer_reviews.text: Overly simple and somewhat boring. Unless you're going to turn it into a drinking game, I'd guess it doesn't have much use for anyone over the age of six. My boyfriend and I completed the game in literally two minutes. Zero use for a game night. Probably great for children, though.
customer_reviews.author: Krista H.

customer_reviews.title: my kids love it
customer_reviews.text: This a great classic game. My kids are 4 and 6, and they really like to play it. The game board is "busier" than the classic version, but it's still great.
customer_reviews.author: Kim M

customer_reviews.title: Great 1st boardgame for kids
customer_reviews.text: I last played this over thirty years ago. Bought this for my son. Simplistic concept, but easy enough for a 3 year to grasp - which I guess is the whole point. Included in the rules is way of playing the game by drawing two cards each turn then allowing the player to choose which card to play. A simple method of introducing decision-making. The game-board is approximately 18"x24" in size. Initially, the board seemed rather small, however, I suppose the smaller size makes it easier for a child to reach across the entire board. Very colorful as always, although the subject matter of the game seems to increase the craving for sweets afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: G. Park

customer_reviews.title: Cant beat the classic
customer_reviews.text: My kiddos were thrilled to get this game for Christmas. Its simple enough for toddlers and still fun for adults. Great tool for learning colors. Speaking of which the pictures are bright and colorful! We are spending hours and hours racing to the Castle!
customer_reviews.author: Once A Critic

customer_reviews.title: Thank you
customer_reviews.text: Great present - time tested. Every generation loves this game! Nice, sweet game! Grandson is 6 and loves it. Put down the electronic stuff-(wow what a concept!).
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Good game to play with the family
customer_reviews.text: Trying to inculcate the habit of playing board games in my 3.5 yr old daughter. That's why I purchased this game. Nice way to spend time together during winters. Yet to play the game. But it seems really interesting.
customer_reviews.author: Bose

customer_reviews.title: Hasbro Candy Land Game is a Classic!
customer_reviews.text: Adults used to play this game when they were children and so did their grandparents! Solid, entertaining game for little ones! Colorfully designed! Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Old time classic game
customer_reviews.text: Perfect game for my grand daughters. They are 3 and 5 and it didn't take long for them to really understand how to play. This is an old time classic game. It reinforces counting and colors for the little ones.
customer_reviews.author: ps8

customer_reviews.title: Great game for kids
customer_reviews.text: What a fun game for toddlers:) our daughter keeps asking to play this game multiple times and is so excited. Very easy instructions for little one:)
customer_reviews.author: Alya

customer_reviews.title: A nice game for very young age, but very low quality production
customer_reviews.text: It's a classic but I tried it for the first time, it's a sweet and easier version of Ladders & Snakes using colors instead of numbers. The kids liked it, so it's nice when they play alone, it would have been boring if I needed to play again and again with them... The play time was too fast, the cards are of poor quality. Bottom line - there are plenty of better games today but a classic is a classic.
customer_reviews.author: Shahar Kaminski

customer_reviews.title: Such a fun game for young children
customer_reviews.text: What young child (& adults playing with them) doesn’t love this game? It’s simplicity shows kids colors, following directions & social skills (taking turns is tops)!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted for my preschoolers
customer_reviews.text: I work at a daycare teaching preschool and 4K children. We had an old Candy Land that is now missing special cards and falling apart, so I got this. It's just what I wanted, sturdy, colorful, and the same rules so they already know how to set it up.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Classic game
customer_reviews.text: I remember playing this as a kid and I bought this recently for my daughter and she just loves it too. She is only 3 and I expect we will get at least a few years out of this game! It is exactly as expected. If I had any criticism it is that the cards are too flimsy but I do think that they are normal quality for board games.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Another generation can share the fun!
customer_reviews.text: Our 3-year-old granddaughter loves it. There's nothing disturbingly cheap about the game, so it looks like it will hold up under reasonable use. It's nice that the directions offer options for making the game go quicker. Under the regular rules a game lasts about 15 minutes. Seems about right for young children.
customer_reviews.author: A. J. Sloane

customer_reviews.title: A Rite of Passage
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed playing Candyland with my five year old grandson, who promptly beat me the first time we played! I played this game with his mother back in the 80s!
customer_reviews.author: RCSK

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: It's ok but there is so much going on... on the board it makes it hard for younger players to follow the colors or directions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: just like you remembered
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter is three and we enjoyed playing the game. No bells, no whistles just pick a card and move. People should not forget about these games, there is quite a lot to learn with this type of play.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for this generation of kids.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this a a gift for my 7 year old niece. The last time I played this game was probably about 25+ years ago. This version is nicely updated with images that kids these days can relate to. There is even a character that looks like a Barbie Elsa. The board is a nice size and the images are clear. I would recommend this or purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: 5 year old boy loves it
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old brother loved it so much that we played it twice after we got it. It was simple enough for him to get the rules but also not super super easy to win (I kept getting sent back with the picture cards in the first game and him in the second). My first time playing Candy Land as well. He also liked the story that goes along with the game and made up stories and dialogue as we passed by the different characters and sections of the board.
customer_reviews.author: Masha

customer_reviews.title: Candyland easy to learn and a grab the attention of the little ones
customer_reviews.text: Brought this for Christmas for my little great niece she loved the game and so did all her brother and sisters they played together nice
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s Candyland but CRAZY looking
customer_reviews.text: The game board is SO DIFFERENT waaaay busier. Anyone around my age (32) or older will be surprised when they see it. But overall, it’s Candyland
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: No game cards!
customer_reviews.text: Was so excited to play this with my 3 year old but it didn't have the game cards! It says on the instructions what is included & it says Game board, figures & cards but no cards. Sad.
customer_reviews.author: Yaneth.L

customer_reviews.title: updated version, still easy to play
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old loves this game and will even play by himself sometimes. It has updated artwork on the board but the same old fun and easy concept.
customer_reviews.author: JessicaH

customer_reviews.title: Board is to chaotic
customer_reviews.text: I hate the new board. It’s so cluttered with so many designs that it’s quite hard for my beginner to focus on where the road actually is.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all!
customer_reviews.text: Great and fun game for little ones to learn and play. Also, its been an entertaining game to play with our 5-year-old during stay-at-home. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: BranfordMrs

customer_reviews.title: A special gift for a special child
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I have mentored through our church with the KIDS Hope program for 14 years. We are with a local elementary school. Candy Land is a HUGE favorite with kids in the 1st to 3rd grades. We bought this for an end-of-the-year party for my 3rd grader to share at home this summer with her younger brothers.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley

customer_reviews.title: Great Classic
customer_reviews.text: This game never goes out of style. Still fun to play, easy to learn, great price on Amazon. Graphics are bright and engaging.
customer_reviews.author: Angela C. Scudder

customer_reviews.title: Nice, solid product!
customer_reviews.text: We had been gifted a version of this before we purchased it. My son played it frequently and it was cheaply made so it broke. I was looking for a version that was a solid product, not made cheaply and this is it! If you love the classic game and are searching for a product that will last, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Trexler

customer_reviews.title: relive the fun you had as a child
customer_reviews.text: i had so much fun playing this as a kid , now witnessing the excitement and joy my kids express every day when we play , makes this one of my smartest buys
customer_reviews.author: Troy Graham

customer_reviews.title: Great game but my box arrived damaged.
customer_reviews.text: It is Candyland that we all know and love. I just wanted to post that the box arrived cut and damaged. It wasn't worth the hassle of returning it.
customer_reviews.author: firefly77

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Bring back the original design. Just miss the old design. There's nothing innapropiate about this. People are too sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: Klkj04

product_meta.title: Hasbro Gaming Candy Land Kingdom Of Sweet Adventures Board Game For Kids Ages 3 & Up (Amazon Exclusive),Red,Original version
product_meta.description:
If you loved playing the Candy Land board game when you were a child, you can share the experience with your loved ones and start down the "magical" road to sweet surprises! This adorable version of the classic Candy Land game features gingerbread men as movers, colored cards, and fun illustrations that kids love, with different destinations like Cookie Commons and the chunky Chocolate Mountain. Players choose their cards, move their pawns, and let their imaginations soar as they make their way to the castle to win! For 2 to 4 players. Hasbro Gaming and all related terms are trademarks of Hasbro.

AMAZON.COM
"Once upon a time, King Kandy, the Imperial Head Bonbon and Grand Jujube of Candy Land disappeared." Thus begins the magical journey of Milton Bradley's classic Candy Land board game. Captivated by the story of a kidnapped king and eager to help find him, little ones move their gingerbread pawns along a rainbow path and through a land of candy characters, all subjects of King Kandy's realm. 

 Playing cards thoughtfully designed for non-readers are coded with colorful squares matching the jeweled stepping-stone path or an occasional token matching one of the characters' symbols: draw a blue card, move to the nearest blue stepping-stone; draw a snowflake and earn a visit to Queen Frostine's iceberg. There are occasional pitfalls, too: land on the wrong square and you might be stuck in Molasses Swamp until a red card is drawn. With all these enticing, sugarcoated images (and King Kandy plainly visible at path's end), children can't help but be delighted by Candy Land. It's delicious! Instructions are in both Spanish and English. Candy Land is for two to four players) --Julie Ubben

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Every child's first game, Candy Land is a colorful way for a preschooler to experience the joy of game play. The game teaches color recognition and matching while reinforcing the lesson of taking turns and being a gracious winner or loser. You will love to see the smile on a young person's face as they travel through Candy Land. Includes four gingerbread pawns, a gameboard, a card deck, and instructions in English and Spanish.

REVIEW


For 2 to 4 players Includes game board, game cards, and plastic playing pieces No reading required to play Skills: color recognition Supply is limited -- 

See more
feature_bullets: CLASSIC BEGINNER GAME: Do you remember playing Candy Land when you were a kid. Introduce new generations to this sweet kid's board game
RACE TO THE CASTLE: Players encounter all kinds of delicious surprises as they move their cute gingerbread man pawn around the path in a race to the castle
NO READING REQUIRED TO PLAY: For kids ages 3 and up, Candy Land can be a great game for kids who haven't learned how to read yet
GREAT GAME FOR LITTLE ONES: The Candy Land board game features colored cards, sweet destinations and fun illustrations that kids love
Includes game board, 4 pawns, card deck and instructions
Sweet version of the classic boardgame features a race to the castle
You encounter all kinds of delicious surprises
